definition: clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
to assume one's post with the aspiration of bringing about peace and order to the nation (idiom)

sentences.english: Drache to confidential action content, therefore has not to clarify in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 卓凱爲了保密行動內容，故一直沒有就此事作出澄清。

sentences.english: And certain high-risk professions and hobbies usually have to be disclosed.
sentences.chinese: 某些高風險職業和業餘愛好通常也必須予以說明澄清。

sentences.english: I write because I want to clear some misconceptions about Yoon Eun Hye.
sentences.chinese: 我寫這席話，是因爲我想澄清一些關於尹恩惠的誤解。

sentences.english: I should say this, that Pat doesn't have a mink coat.
sentences.chinese: 我應該澄清的是，帕特並沒有貂皮大衣。

sentences.english: Experiment study of soak juice by tartary buckwheat bran the clarification technology and store the stabilities.

sentences.english: Mining minister said immediately come forward to clarify earlier in the ghost story.
sentences.chinese: 採臣見狀立即上前澄清早前遇鬼的說法。

sentences.english: I just want to clarify that it is an electron.
sentences.chinese: 我想澄清的是它是一個電子。

sentences.english: My fair skin didn’t help clarify matters either.
sentences.chinese: 我白皙的皮膚也於澄清事情毫無助益。

sentences.english: A discussion is made on the basic concept of rock weathering, and some fuzzy cognition is clarified.
sentences.chinese: 討論巖體風化的基本概念，澄清一些傳統的模糊認識。

sentences.english: As a community, this is the perfect time to clarify these differences.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個社區，這正是澄清所有這些區別的絕佳時機。

sentences.english: Tonight Jobs cleared up the matter once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 今晚喬布斯徹底地澄清了這個問題。

sentences.english: I will gladly share more details if you have questions or clarifications.
sentences.chinese: 我會很樂意分享更多的細節，如果您有問題或澄清。

sentences.english: Jack needed time to clear himself of burglary charges.
sentences.chinese: 傑克需要一點時間來澄清自己是強盜的指控罪名。

sentences.english: Any questions, clarifications, etc, please let us know.
sentences.chinese: 有任何疑問，澄清等，請告訴我們。

sentences.english: Therefore, it is necessary to clarify people's understanding of universality from various perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 在多樣性的視域中，澄清人們對普世性的認識。

sentences.english: It takes courage to raise your hand and ask for clarification.
sentences.chinese: 它給你舉手澄清問題的勇氣。

definition: to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear
to declare to be untrue/to deny
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
